intro: Eggelingia gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon eggplant, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, egg-shaped fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white with yellow stamens. The plant is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates, often in well-drained soils.
